intro: Lingoum dalbergioides, commonly known as the silky bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in soft, silky hairs, giving it its common name. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters. Lingoum dalbergioides is often used in traditional medicine and as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance.
